direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods check for the presence of an element in the map but focus on different aspects (key vs. value).
The get method can be used to check for the presence of a key by verifying if the returned value is null.
Both methods involve checking for the presence of a key and handling the absence of the key similarly.
Both methods access and modify the internal buckets and locks structures.
Both methods use the getHash method to determine the bucket index, sharing a common internal structure.

enhanced_by.reason: The put method can be used to populate the map with keys that can then be checked by containsKey.
The getHash method is invoked before containsKey to determine the bucket index.
The get method can be used to verify the presence of a key after containsKey has been invoked.
